intro: Pennisetum chudeaui subsp. monodii, commonly known as blue fescue, is a perennial grass native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its fine, silver-blue foliage and compact growth habit, making it a popular ornamental plant. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and produces small, fluffy seed heads in late summer. It prefers well-drained soil and full sun, and is drought-tolerant once established. Its unique color and texture make it a valuable addition to rock gardens and borders.
